title: 2D Core
intro:
The core of 2D consists of just one object (in the global scope): `Game`. Game is javascript contstructor, so with `new Game(...)` you can create as many Games as you wish on a sigle page, even with completely different options.
Game has just a few methods and variables, mainly for the game loop, starting and stopping, and managing plugins. That's the true power and beauty of 2D: it consists of a very small core, with all the functionality added with plugins, like `Draw`, `Collisions` etc. There are a few basic plugins, in `src/plugins`.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: An object containing some options. All possible keys can be found in `options.md`. For no options, use an empty Object.

arguments.name: plugins
arguments.description: An object containing some plugins to be added to the Game. Keys are plugin type (e.g. `Colliders`), values are the plugins (as passed to `Game.plugin()`).

arguments.name: scene
arguments.description: An integer or string referencing a scene. This will be passed to `Game.world.load()`

children.name: stop
children.description: Stop the Game. Calls Reset; to stop the Game temporarily, consider using `Game.pause()` instead.

children.name: pause
children.description: Pause the Game. After pause, the Game can easily be resumed with `Game.start()`.

children.name: init
children.description: Initialise the Game. This loads the first scene, initialises the categories, colliders etc.

arguments.name: scene
arguments.description: An identifier for a Scene or a Scene. This will be passed to `Game.world.load()`

children.name: reset
children.description: Reset the Game, i.e. reset it to a clean state, so a Scene can be loaded and started without glitches. This involves resetting positions, timers, etc.

children.name: Worlds
children.description: `Worlds` contains all the World managing functions, provided by a Worlds plugin. Check `docs/[json|md|html]/worlds.[json|md|html]` for more info.

children.name: Colliders
children.description: ``Colliders` contains all the Collider logic, like collider constructors and collision checks, provided by a Colliders plugin. Check `docs/[json|md|html]/colliders.[json|md|html]` for more info.

children.name: Categories
children.description: `Categories` contains all the Category managing functions. Check `docs/[json|md|html]/categories.[json|md|html]` for more info.

children.name: Camera
children.description: `Camera` holds the Camera logic, provided by a Camera plugin. Check `docs/[json|md|html]/camera.[json|md|html]` for more info.

children.name: Draw
children.description: `Draw` contains all the drawing functions, provided by a Draw plugin. Check `docs/[json|md|html]/draw.[json|md|html]` for more info.
